symptoms.name: White or beige nodules on hair shafts
Increased hair fragility
symptoms.pattern: May be present, but not always a common feature

physical_findings: White to beige nodules, distributed at irregular intervals along the hair shaft
Nodules not easily movable along the hair shaft
Normal-looking scalp with abundant hair, without sparseness
No fluorescence on Wood's lamp examination
Firm white concretions, about 1 millimeter in diameter, adherent to the hair shaft
Trichoscopic evaluation confirming tubular concretions of proteinaceous material tightly adherent to the hair shaft

lab_values.KOH mount: Clusters of arthrospores cemented in an extracellular matrix, firmly adherent to the hair shaft, with focal presence of brown pigment
lab_values.Fungal culture (SDA without cycloheximid: White cerebriform colonies with characteristic “butter cream frosting”
lab_values.Periodic acid-Schiff\u2013diastase stain: Aggregates of septated hyphae and budding spores (arthroconidia and blastoconidia)

risk_factors: Warm and moist conditions on the scalp
Habit of tying wet hair after washing

imaging_findings.Trichoscopy: White amorphous material locally encasing the hair

required: Presence of white or beige nodules on hair shafts
Positive fungal culture for Trichosporon species
supportive: Microscopic examination showing arthrospores and hyphae
Trichoscopic findings consistent with white piedra
